bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 164, Number 29 (Wednesday, February 14, 2018)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. LOEBSACK:H.R. 5020.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, Clause I of the Constitution[Page H1178]

item.name: Early Childhood, Elementary, and Secondary Education Subcommittee
Early Childhood, Elementary, and Secondary Education Subcommittee

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Early Childhood, Elementary, and Secondary Education.
Referred to the House Committee on Education and the Workforce.

summary.text:
Collaboration for Today's Education Act or the CTE Act

This bill requires the Department of Education to establish a program to award grants to secondary schools that form a partnership with a community college to allow students in their junior and senior years to experience career and technical education courses at such community college.

bill.title: CTE Act

item.title: To provide for the establishment of a Department of Education program to award grants to secondary schools that establish a project to encourage students in their junior and senior school years to experience career and technical education courses at a community college, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Early Childhood, Elementary, and Secondary Education.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
